children.text: The carpet join is clearly visible/peaking, which looks poorly finished.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 18.10 Floor Coverings states
‘Joins in carpet and vinyl are defective if they peak, fray or misalign and are visible from a normal viewing position within 12 months from handover.’
The carpet join in this area must be rectified so it is no longer visible, or the carpet be replaced.
